description: tafelspitz is boiled beef in broth, viennese style and is a typical austrian dish. the beef is simmered along with root vegetables and spices in the broth. it is usually served with roasted slices of potato and a mix of minced apples and horseradish or sour cream mixed with horseradish. franz joseph i, emperor of austria, was a great lover of tafelspitz. according to the 1912 official cookery textbook used in domestic science schools of the austro-hungarian empire, "his majesty's private table is never without a fine piece of boiled beef, which is one of his favorite dishes." tafelspitz is considered to be the national dish of austria.
